data.title: Hooper Graff Toler Jr (1874-1947)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Sydney Toler Jr born 1874 Warrensburg, Johnson, Missouri, United States died 1947 California, United States including ancestors + questions + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Hooper Graff (Sydney) "Sidney" Toler Jr

Born 28 Apr 1874 in Warrensburg, Johnson, Missouri, United States

Ancestors

Brother of Matthew F. Toler and Edwin Clayton Toler

Husband of Josephine Marie (Gaspar) Marston-Toler — married 29 Aug 1906 (to 7 Oct 1943) in Manhattan, New York, New York, United States

[children unknown]

Died 12 Feb 1947 at age 72 in California, United States

Profile last modified 28 Dec 2022 | Created 4 Dec 2018

This page has been accessed 738 times.

Sydney Toler Jr is Notable.

Biography

Hooper G. Toler Jr, known as Sidney Toler was born to Hooper G Toler and Sarah J. Frame in Warrensburg, Missouri. He was an American actor, playwright and theatre director. The second Non-Asian actor to play the role of Charlie Chan on screen, he is best remembered for his portrayal of the Chinese-American detective in 22 films made between 1938 and 1946. He also played supporting roles in 50 motion pictures and a comic actor on the Broadway stage.

Son of Hooper Graff Toler Sr. and Sarah "Sallie" Frame

About 1878, he moved with his family to Wichita, Sedgwick County, Kansas.

Husband of Josephine Gaspar (aka Vivian Marston)

Husband of Viva/Vera Tattersall Orkow
